item.name: Rameselt
entries: Rameselt is a dwarven spice initially used to flavor food but has been found to burn extremely hot and is hard to put out

entries.name: Appearance
entries: Rameselt is a fine powder, as coarse as salt. It can come in colors such as green, orange, red, and yellow.

entries.name: History
entries: Rameselt was created initially as a dye. When dissolved in water it can create vibrant colors that last. It is quite expensive to produce, and it was found to taste quite good. It’s price and good taste made it a commodity for the nobles and rich of Bardoran. During the cooking process it was discovered that it can also be a form of fuel and Bardoran testing found it is a powerful weapon.

entries.name: Ignition
entries: When Rameselt is ignited with a flame, the minerals in it begin melting and it begins to spark at a rapid rate. This sends specks of molten metal flying in out of where the rameselt was ignited. As the rest of the rameselt catches, it pops and shoots out more sparks, and sometimes chunks of rameselt that begin reacting themselves.

item.name: Compass of Garletor
entries: Compass that can points to things hidden with magic, up to 50 ft away

entries.name: Appearance
entries: The Compass of Garletor looks very expensive. It is about 2.5 inches across, with a silver body with carvings of curvy flourishes. The glass on the top has a silver rim around it, and markings on the glass itself, inside of the compass the shiny blue metal needle comes to a point with a carving of an eye at the end. Inside of the compass the backing is a dark metal that has shiny blue flourishes. The top of the compass is comes to a small point to help the user orient themselves toward the hidden subject
The Markings on the glass are runes: seek what is unknown

entries.name: History
entries: The Compass of Garletor was created by the Wizard Garletor for King (Cabil) Furnit II for a raid of a hidden base of cultists using a drop of Hebeshca's blood

trait.name: Dwarven Resilience
entries: The scout has advantage on saving throws against poison.

Bardoran scouts wear light leather armor and carry only daggers and slings. Their main purpose is to lead a stronger force of soldiers to places to attack. They also get information about enemies and chase down enemies that escape battle. They carry a palm sized flare device that consists of a piece of wood wrapped in a cloth that has been coated in flammable liquid. The Scout can ignite the device and use their sling to throw it in the air so that other Bardoran military forces can see their position.

entries: The scout makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Signal
entries: The scout uses its sling to launch a flare into the air for other Bardoran soldier to see.

They wear chainmail armor and carry a whip, shortsword, and shield. Their main function is crowd control of civilians. Today they are used to oversee the workers of the forges.

entries.name: Bardoran
entries: Dwarven Empire that occupies the North

entries.name: Occupants
entries: Dwarves mainly, but there are others that have been left over

entries.name: Economy
entries: Bardoran Is the main metal producer in the world. Trades/sells with metal to Mayland. Food is taken tax from Warberland

entries.name: Government
entries: The Bardoran governement is a monarchy. The nobles of Bardoran also have governing power but the king has the final say

entries.name: Rulers
entries: Barus Torid → Dremin Warberset

entries.name: Military
entries: The Bardoran military is extremely large and powerful.Its ground troops are feared, and it has secretly begun work on a powerful Navy

entries.name: History
entries: The Small kingdom of Bardoran was founded by Barus Torid in 1442 CE. Similar to the kingdoms around, Bardoran was a small mining kingdom with little actual power or class system. At the time, there was only the miner middle class and the leading upper class where the miners would get resources and the leaders would manage and sell the resources. Bardoran sustained itself by selling raw minerals to nearby nations with processing infrastructure in exchange for food.

In 1545, Torid retired and gave his crown to Dremin Warberset, a close advisor. Previous to this, Warberset had helped to negotiate trade deals with the nearby nations where he would sell raw materials in exchange tools, or a cut of processed metal for use of their forges. These greatly increased the quality of life for Bardoran miners, as well as their efficiency. This along with Warberset’s vision of a united dwarven kingdom made Torid feel Warberset would be a good king.

Over time, the citizens of Bardoran and Warberset himself began to become frustrated with nearby nations encroaching and forming trade agreements without Bardoran. Kershak took advantage of this frustration and made a deal with Warberset. With Kershak’s help, Bardoran easily took over its previously equally matched neighboring nations. Bardoran used the claimed resources to grow a powerful military force, and with the help of Kershak, conquered the north. Bardoran stopped expanding with the capturing of Artoz in 1608 C.E. after which the colony Warberland was made in its place

entries.name: Outside Relations
entries: relations

entries.name: Features
entries: {@bold Class System.} The majority of Bardoran are peasants who work in the mines. Each mine is owned by one of the nobles, who profit from them without doing much actual work. Nobels are like the kings of their mine. The military keeps the worker in check. The mines are filled with enforcers.

entries.name: Warberland
entries: Poor colony of Bardoran

entries.name: Occupants
entries: Many different races. Originally occupied by humans, Halflings, Satyr, and similar creatures. During the conquest of the north, Bardoran pushed many other races like Kobalts and dragonborns down into the south.

entries.name: Economy
entries: Little economic prosperity. There are many farms in Warberland but Bardoran taxes them by taking their crops, so the area is in poverty

entries.name: History
entries: The land occupied by Warberland was once the nation Artoz. In 1608 CE Atroz attempted to fight Bardoran avoid it becoming too powerful, but it was already too late, and Atroz to crushed by the Bardoran Military. At the start of the campaign, this was the last conquest by Bardoran. When it was conquered by Bardoran, the area was named Warberland and it became a colony that bardoran takes advantage of for food.

entries.name: Tarehas
entries: Small island kingdom

entries.name: Occupants
entries: Mainly Human, but there are some human-like races like Halflings, Orcs. Not a very dense population

entries.name: Economy
entries: Keeps to itself, sustains itself from fishing, logging to build boats. Metal tools are bought from Mayland

entries.name: Government
entries: Monarchy. The somewhat small island nation managed to maintain a king who makes all laws because of its size and the traditional hearing hours

entries.name: Rulers
entries: . Percy Aerwyna → Ben Aerwyna → Percival Aerwyna → George Aerwyna → Daniel Aerwyna. Currently prince Alric Aerwyna is next in line.

entries.name: Military
entries: Before the attacks of Selatis, the Tarehas military was a moderate size. It was enough to fend pirates off, and that is generally what was needed. Because of the the navy was the most funded part of the military.

entries.name: History
entries: King Percy Aerwyna formed in 1564 CE. At the time, the land was traveled to in search of resources, but there weren't any unique ones. Some humans moved there, including a young Percy Aerwyna, and formed small separate communities. Eventually Aerwyna made good relations with the other groups, and he declared the island Tarehas

entries.name: Selatis
entries: Costal kingdom that attacked Tarehas

entries.name: Occupants
entries: Very diverse. Originally mostly human, but more races have mingled with the rest.

entries.name: Economy
entries: Fishing and farming crops to sustain itself. Sells wood to Mayland

entries.name: Government
entries: Monarchy, with a council of 30 lords. Both the king and the council of lords need to agree on a law to pass it, either can introduce one

entries.name: Rulers
entries: Michael Wilber → Gordon Wilber → Tyler Wilber → Samuel Cartage → William Cartage → Morgan Darius → Thomas Darius

entries.name: Military
entries: Moderate military strength. Large naval fleet, and many guards, but the military tends to stay around the wealthy/noble areas

entries.name: History
entries: The land that Selatis occupies was once many informal nations. King Michael Wilber united many groups against ones that were terrorizing the others, and formed the kingdom in 1318 CE. The area expanded through a couple wars and a few treaties

entries.name: Outside Relations
entries: relations

entries.name: Features
entries: {@bold Festival of Selatis.} A week long festival that takes place every year to celebrate the Founding of Selatis. The festival brings in many outside visitors

entries.name: Mayland
entries: Manufacturing kingdom

entries.name: Occupants
entries: Very diverse. Many people travel through Mayland as well

entries.name: Economy
entries: Manufacturing and transport of goods. Mayland doesn’t actually produce many things but It buys many raw materials that it makes into other things. It also has large businesses in transporting such goods

entries.name: Government
entries: Mayland does not have an official government, the area is more of a union of many powerful companies. The higher ups of these companies make decisions with each other, so there is sort of a council, but laws are generally decided by the individual companies.

entries.name: Military
entries: There is no formal Mayland military, but individual companies often hire guards for protection of their goods. These goods usually protect the company’s property (land, valuables), he estates of the company owners, or to enforce on the factory floor, but there is little protection for the lower class. This means violence is somewhat common in the slums of the lower class.

entries.name: History
entries: Mayland was created when many companies in the area agreed to form a union. Over time, different companies had started to independently form along the River Zurn, and the company heads decided to form a name for the area

entries.name: Gartana
entries: powerful military kingdom

entries.name: Occupants
entries: Very diverse.

entries.name: Economy
entries: Ship building. Makes deals with independent parties where they provide military force. Most of the food is produced in Kortain.

entries.name: Government
entries: The Gartana government consists of a king and representatives from different areas of Gartana

entries.name: Rulers
entries: Evan Marris → Pladis Marris → Gregory Furnit → Cabil Furnit → Gregory (II) Furnit → Dawsor Clumond → Tershar Artus

entries.name: Military
entries: Gartana has great pride of it’s military. Being a union formed from wanting defence, Gartana has put many resources into its military. The Gartana military has both great equipment and numbers of soldiers. They often flaunt their military, through both army and naval parades. Each district has their own military that ultimately can be controlled by the king, but are meant to handle affairs locally.

entries.name: History
entries: Gartana was formed originally as a union military of smaller nations who wanted security. There were generally many land disputes at the time, and many pirates that took advantage of the weak and small nations. After the Great Lemis War, Gartana formed an official kingdom.

entries.name: Outside Relations
entries: relations

entries.name: Features
entries: {@bold Military Culture.} Gartana has great values of strength because of its past. From a young age citizens of Gartana are taught to respect and honor the military. Joining the military is a common path for many young people.

entries.name: Kortain
entries: growing farming kingdom

entries.name: Occupants
entries: Very diverse.

entries.name: Economy
entries: Sells crops to other nations and participates in slave trades. Kortain also has a very large real estate market for wealthy entrepreneurs to begin industry. Kortain, being a somewhat newer kingdom, is trying to grow it’s economic influence

entries.name: Government
entries: The Kortain government consists of a king and representatives from different areas of Kortain

entries.name: Rulers
entries: Totartec Brus → Preesha Hasheguel → Weltor Kalbos

entries.name: Military
entries: The Kortain Military is relatively strong, but it mainly is for defense. As a result the military tends to stay around heavily populated, especially wealthy, areas

entries.name: History
entries: Kortain was founded by one of the clans that participated in the Great Lemis War. Overtime as other clans fell, they took up the land. None of Kortain has been taken as a result of force by Kortain, but Kortain scavanges destroyed kingdoms or suffering territories and offers them to join.

entries.name: Thrun
entries: growing desert kingdom

entries.name: Occupants
entries: Very diverse.

entries.name: Government
entries: The Thrun government is a council of the wealthiest citizens of Thrun

entries.name: Military
entries: Thrun has a small but well armed military. The Thrun military is used only to defend the property of the wealthy. The wealthy also tends to hire their own personal guards

entries.name: History
entries: Thrun was founded by a group of four powerful gangs in 1649. The desert is a lawless and environmentally harsh area with no real ruler. Thrun was founded to establish a permanent area of power. The Four gangs joined forces to combat other gangs and groups of gangs, and set up permanent settlements at the tip of the dry mountains. The gangs were quite wealthy, and quickly were able to buy supplies and slaves to begin building their kingdom. Entrepreneurs joined to grow their wealth in the growing Kingdom.

entries.name: Outside Relations
entries: relations

entries.name: Features
entries: {@bold Class System.} Thrun has a very wide wealth gap. There are many people who hope to gain wealth from the growing area, but few actually do. Those who are already wealthy have gained more wealth from the area. On the other hand, Thrun’s economy is based on the work of slaves

entries: the hidden elf kingdom

entries.name: Occupants
entries: Elfs. not a very huge population ~ 35000

entries.name: Economy
entries: Self sustained farming and foraging

entries.name: Government
entries: There is a council of 10 leaders who make the decisions. Sometimes they will ask for the opinion of Atheria, or be commanded by her.

entries.name: Military
entries: There once was a much greater military of Elestir, but the population in general has decreased. There are only ~5000 in the official Elestir military, but most of the population are apt fighters

entries.name: History
entries: Atheria created the elfs as her mortal followers BCE, and many remained in the Forest Drisk, forming Elestir

entries.name: Verathon
entries: the hidden drow kingdom

entries.name: Occupants
entries: Drow. not a very dense population ~ 10000

entries.name: Economy
entries: Self sustained farming and foraging of cave organisms, like fungi

entries.name: Government
entries: Matriarchy. Freiseln makes the final decision, but she communicates greatly with her followers, and allows anyone to seek her presence

entries.name: Military
entries: There ae many apt fighters in Verathon, but not a formal military. One is not needed for such an isolated nation. If need be, the more able Drow will take up arms in honor of Verathon

entries.name: History
entries: The some elfs split off from the Elestir in allegiance to Freiseln who left her mother, Atheria. They asked Freiseln to make their skin the same dark purple as hers as a sign of allegiance. Thus the drow were born, and they retreated to the dark caves under the Forest Drisk. BCE

entries.name: Outside Relations
entries: The Drow in the past interacted a bit more than they currently do. Groups of Drow would travel out of curiosity. People knew Drow exist, but they were very rare to see. The Drow were always very secretive about their settlement. When Bardoran began to take control of the north, Freiseln ordered a stop to travel to be cautious of the violent times.

entries.name: Features
entries: {@bold Verathon Community ideals.} The Drow are held together by a strong sense of community. Honor is seen as acting for the ones you love. Freiseln set up these ideals to contrast her mother, who she sees as self absorbed.

{@bold The Verathon Ceremony.} Every year the Drow have a ceremony on the day that they succeeded from Elestir. At first this ceremony was to commemorate this day, but over time it has become less about Elestir, and more about the formation of Verathon in general. In the ceremony, those coming of age take a rounded knife called a fear-cleaver and cut a nonlethal wound on a part of their body they choose to demonstrate they are ready to give to the community. Frieseln then wraps the wound with webs. The cut leaves a scar that the drow often look at to remind themselves of their community

entries.name: The Start of Conquest (1576)
entries: Before Bardoran took over, it was a much smaller nation of miners like the nations around it. Eventually the miners of each nation began mine in the same areas and conflicts grew over territory. On a few occasions these disputes became violent. The leaders of these nations made an agreement over territory, but resentment remained in the minds of the miners.

Before the conquest Bardoran and its neighbors had trade deals where Bardoran would gain access to the large forges of the nearby nations to process mined goods, and give the owner of the forge a cut of the results. In 1562, Bardoran began construction on its own forge which made the nearby nations feel betrayed. They began cutting Bardoran out of trade agreements which greatly stunted Bardoran’s previously growing economy. This increased tensions further.
In 1575, Kershak agreed to provide his services in combat as part of the deal with the Bardoran king Dremin Warberset.

entries.name: Throughout the Conquest (1575-1607)
entries: Kershak’s demonic power could easily and quickly defeat the armies of other nations, at which point the Bardoran army would raid the remains of the nations. If the nation was dwarven bardoran would recruit the workers into the army, and kill/imprison those that didn’t. Non-dwarven groups were slaughtered or displaced.

As the conquest went on, the bardoran army itself became a powerful force and Kershak was needed less and less. Eventually Bardoran was able to conquer nations without Kershak’s help. Kershak did provide aid near the end of the conquest to defeat Merazarx.

entries.name: Kershak - Merazarx Battle (1607)
entries: in 1607, Kershak entered the Warberset mountains before the Bardoran troops because he knew that Merazarx would be able to defeat them. By this point the Bardoran army was powerful enough to conquer nations themselves, but Kershak knew Merazarx was very powerful. Merazarx told her followers to prepare for an attack by Bardoran when it first began expanding and she remained ready to fight Kershak head on. As she predicted Kershak and Bardoran arrived, and a battle between the two immortals began. The battle lasted hours and left both nearly dead. Kershak was overall victorious but very weak. Wanting to avoid the will of Merzarx activating, Kershak trapped Merazarx in an enchanted dungeon under Dran’s Deep that would keep her incapacitated and contained.

entries.name: End of the Conquest (1607)
entries: After his battle with Merazarx in 1607, Kershak wanted to take time to regain power. At the same time, the nobles of Bardoran were satisfied with the loot they had acquired. In 1608 the nation Artoz feared for its safety and attacked Bardoran preemptively. Bardoran responded with a massive military attack that easily crushed Artoz. Bardoran pulled most of their troops back into the north and instead had a much smaller military presence to establish a colony which was named Warberland.

entries.name: Cain Expresses Concern (1580)
entries: After the first years of Bardoran’s conquest, Cain became increasingly more concerned with his intentions. Cain knew Kershak was greedy and powerful, and he wondered if his brother intended to take over the world. Cain also knew there were many powerful creatures throughout Cerdia that may be able to oppose his brother.

Cain sent a message expressing that Kershak may be overconfident. Kershak was insulted and angry, but he didn’t initially show it. Kershak also suspected that Cain was trying to get him to stop so that he could get the will of Sellarus himself.

entries.name: Kershak Betrays Cain (1580)
entries: Kershak invited Cain and his acolytes to join him in his volcanic lair. Kershak said was going to explain his plans to Cain and that he had an offer for Cain. Cain agreed to meet and brought his acolytes with him. At the time Cain had dozens of acolytes who formed a cult that did Cain’s bidding. Once They arrived at Kershak’s lair, Kershak brought Cain to a separate room as Bardoran troops and Serick blocked the exit and began slaughtering Cain’s acolytes. Kershak brought Cain to a balcony to watch his acolytes being massacred, and decapitated the shocked Cain before he could react.

entries.name: Impacts (1580 - Present)
entries: Cain was enraged by Kershak’s betrayal, and Kershak was somewhat relieved and empowered. Cain was able to survive by escaping into the nonphysical realm, but he still lost his body and all his acolytes. This was one of the reasons Cain was so willing to accept Aurelius as an acolyte, and spent so much time helping her train.

entries.name: First Tensions (1679 - 1713)
entries: Tensions began during the rule of King (George) Aerwyna III when Selatis fishing boats over time grew closer to Tarehas shores. Up to this point Selatis had respected Tarehas’s territory, but no official agreement was ever made. Aerwyna III sent a message to the current Selatis king, (Thomas) Darius II asking to formalize these boundaries in the Tellensa Treaty. The negotiation process was tense, both sides trying to take as much of the sea as possible, but an agreement was made. Both Selatis fishers and Tarehas fishers ignored the agreements, and the tensions grew among the fisherpeople.

entries.name: Capture of the Salthopper (1713)
entries: The Salthopper was a fishing boat of Tarehas citizens that in April of 1713, went into some of the dedicated Selatis waterspace of the Tellensa Treaty. The area was part of a breeding space of tuna, and many Selatis fishers were angry the Salthopper was taking all the fish. The Selatis fishers reported the Salthopper to the Selatis navy, who sent a ship that arrested the Tarehas fishers, and claimed the boat. Tarehas responded by beginging to take control of Selatis fishing boats in their area.

entries.name: Declaration of War (1713)
entries: After Tarehas began capturing Selatis fishing ships, Selatis sent a feel of 12 naval ships to reclaim them. During negotiations, one of the ships was secretly set ablaze by Selatis and blamed on the Tarehas military. Tarehas claimed it was an independent citizen, but Selatis declared war

entries.name: Battle of Golscon (1713)
entries: Upon Decree of war, the Naval ships already at Tarehas moved began firing on the naval ships of Tarehas, before leaving for reinforcements. Tarehas prepared as well as they could, mainly preparing to help the royals escape. The Selatis navy returned with many more ships that easily crushed the Tarehas navy. Once reaching land, the Selatis navy had much more trouble navigating through the unfamiliar land, but they reached the Castle itself within a day with their much greater numbers

entries.name: Escape of the Royals (1713)
entries: Many Selatis naval ships stayed in the water to catch the royal family if they try to escape. Knowing this, each member of the royal family set out in separate, small sailboats, along with many other decoy sailboats being steered by soldiers. The Selatis navy soon caught on to this, and only the prince escaped by going around the west side of the island and eventually reaching Warberland. The King and Queen were imprisoned and brought to Selatis as prisoners

entries.name: Battle of Delorna (1713)
entries: Selatis pulled most of its troops away from Tarehas after the castle was taken. Those that remained began to establish control over the island, claiming it as territory of Selatis. Selatis underestimated the will of many civilians in Tarehas, and many fought back in the small town of Delorno.The Selatis soldiers were pushed back and the townspeople retreated into the forest. The Selatis soldiers asked for more aid from Selatis, but they were told eventually some would come..

entries.name: Stalemate (1713 - Present)
entries: After the Battle of Delorno, the Selatis soldiers remained in the castle while the Tarehas resistance continued to hide and move around in Tarehas. The result is a form of guerilla warfare from the resistance. Soon, the dwindling Selatis forces began to remain in the castle until they can receive more help.

entries.name: Inital Tensions (1540)
entries: In 1540 Tensions grew between the Drow and the town of Craiton (currently Kortain) when Craiton began to do extreme logging. The drow rely on the forest ecology to survive and they surfaced to express this. The Craiton lumberjacks called 30 soldiers to talk to the Drow diplomats. The 10 Drow that came to express the concerns were armed, but they were not wielding their weapons when they came to negotiate. After some arguing, a Craiton guard pushed one of the Drow in anger, and a different Drow pushed the guard back and knocked him over. The guards then drew their swords, followed by the Drow, and a battle broke out

entries.name: The First Battle (1540)
entries: The extremely skilled drow killed all but 5 of the soldier who they left to run away. A few of the Drow had bad cuts, but nothing that was permanent. The Craiton soldiers returned to the town and war was declared.

entries.name: The Destruction of Craiton (1540)
entries: The Craiton soldiers entered the forest Drisk, trying to find the Drow settlement. Anticipating this, The Drow had prepared arms and ambushed the Craitonians. The Drow easily massacred the heavily armored soldiers trying to move throughout the dense forest. Many Craitonians did retreat and the Drow followed. A battle ensued in the Capital of Craiton. The Cratonians were now in more familiar territory, but the drow were much more skilled and coordinated. They were able to reach the house of Lord _ and demanded he take his people north. The city of Craiton was abandoned, and later the land was taken up by Kortain.

entries.name: Impacts (1540 - Present)
entries: The world began to be very wary of the Drow. Since Craiton had a very strong military, it’s fall in battle was shocking. Kortain eventually took over the land that Craiton once ruled over, but remembering it’s downfall, Kortain has not attempted to expand into the forest

entries.name: The (Aurelis guardian)-(witch) deal
entries: The prince of Tarehas, Alric Aerwyna, is cursed because of something his mother did when she was younger that upset some powerful magic user. Meanwhile, whiles she was young, AG (Aurelis guardian) was learning wizardry (perhaps at freaxir) when a witch began teaching her and so that the witch could take advantage of her. Once she grew up, AG searched for a way to break the curse when she went back to the witch and askked for advice. The witch explained that a drow heart of the same age as Alric's could be used in a ritual. AG went to the forest Drisk and prayed to Freiseln (Per the witch's instructions), explaining the situation, but saying that she wanted the healing power of Freiseln. The drow took pity on her, and brought her to the caves. Freiseln gave her an elixir, and AG took a drow baby on her way out. The elixir healed the sick Alric baby, but as he got older, sickness came back, and AG had to use Aurelius's blood in a potion to heal him. She refused to actualy cut Aurelius's heart out, but the witch was planning to all along for her own gain

entries.name: Hebeshca
entries: Hebeshca is the demon of mystery. She is the wife of Sellarus and the mother of Kershak, Cain, and Armentus

entries.name: Info1
entries: info1  text

entries.name: Kershak
entries: Kershak is the demon that helped Bardoran take over the north. He is the demon of greed and power hunger. Kershak is the eldest child of Sellarus and Habeshca and the brother of Cain and Armentus.

entries.name: Family Relations
entries: Kershak felt Sellarus didn’t use his power to his full extent and that his father cared too much about mortals. Kershak also felt Sellarus didn’t appreciate his power enough.

Kershak initially saw his mother as weak compared to him and Sellarus, but as time went on he realized she was extremely powerful and extremely good at hiding it. This made him afraid of her and whatever she may be plotting.

Kershak saw his siblings as weak compared to him and didn’t really care about them if they didn’t interfere with his plans. For this reason Kershak felt even more disdain towards Sellarus because he felt his father should cherish him the most.

entries.name: The Will of Sellarus (1323)
entries: The will of Sellarus made Kershak extremely mad. Since he was the eldest of Sellarus, Kershak assumed he would get Sellarus’s power if he dies, so when Sellarus made the possibility that any demon could get his power, Kershak was enraged.
Intally Kershak was unaware of the third key but once he learned that Hebeshca had made it and helped hide the will, he also grew resentment towards his mother.

entries.name: The Kershak-Warberset Deal (1575)
entries: Wanting nothing more than more power, Kershak realised that he would need power and help to scour Cerdia for the keys and the will itself. When Bardoran began mining close to his volcanic lair, Kershak was initially annoyed but then saw that he could take advantage of the king, Dremin Warberset. Since Warberset was already mad at neighboring kingdoms, Kershak easily fueled his rage and convinced him to make the Kershak-Warberset deal.

entries.name: The Conquest (1575 - 1608)
entries: Kershak reveled in the fear that mortals had when they first saw him. For Kershak, the conquest was generally enjoyable. He also began to enjoy having an army of minions that would do his bidding.

Soon after the conquest began, Armentus sent a message to Kershak requesting the Armentus - Kershak Deal. Kershak didn’t know much about Freaxir but didn’t see it as a threat, and he didn’t have any plans of expanding south of  what is now the Bardoran river. He agreed, feeling relieved he had one less thing to worry about interfering.

When Cain became worried of Kershak’s greed, he sent a message in 1580 to Kershak warning him that other entities would try to stop him. Kershak saw this message as both an insult and a threat, and decided to remove Cain from the physical plane and kill his acolytes. Kershak invited Cain to discuss and brought him into his lair, where Cain was shown his acolytes being murdered before Kershak decapitated him from behind.

When Kershak reached Merazarx’s territory in 1607, he knew she would put up a fight, but his recent successes against other powerful beings made him feel confident. The battle left Kershak successful but very weak and injured, and he angrily retreated to his volcanic layer. Realising he should avoid killing Merazarx because of her will, he instead used his power to create an enchanted cage under Dran’s Deep that would keep her unconscious and contained.
After his battle with Merazarx, Kershak was frustrated and wanted to ensure control of the territory Bardoran had acquired. He requested Warberset end the conquest

entries.name: Cain
entries: Cain is the demon of mental turmoil and the patron of Aurelius. He is the middle child of Sellarus and Hebeshca, and the brother of Armentus and Kershak.

entries.name: Family Relations
entries: Cain liked Sellarus and followed his example of communicating with mortals. He also inherited his mother’s talent to manipulate mortals and demons alike, and admired her
Cain found both of his siblings annoying in different ways. Cain saw Kershak as egotistical and Armentus as a small nuisance that was always focused on some project he saw as unimportant.

entries.name: Children of Cain
entries: Cain began to collect followers who devoted themselves to having minds of strong will and seeking truth. Cain being the demon of metal turmoil, many saw him as very knowledgeable, and in many areas he was. Those who were most devoted became Cain’s acolytes and would do Cain’s bidding, which usually involved collecting information. The group named themselves the Children of Cain

entries.name: The Will of Sellarus (1323)
entries: Cain was largely uninterested in the Will of Sellarus until he began to think about what would happen if Kershak got it. He began secretly making his acolytes search for the box, and knowing Hebeschca was involved he knew it would be hard to find. It was because of these efforts Cain learned about the Writ of Hebeshca.

entries.name: The Betrayal of Cain (1580)
entries: In 1580, Cain took notice of Kershak’s conquest of the north and began to fear what Kershak was planning. Hoping to calm Kershak down, Cain sent a message saying to Kershak saying that he was going down a dangerous path and he should not overestimate his power. Kershak took this as an insult and invited Cain and his acolytes to join him to discuss a proposition. Cain was intrigued, and he obeyed without suspicion. When he got there, Kershak took him away from his acolytes and then brought him to a balcony where he watched the Children of Cain getting massacred. Before he could react, Cain was beheaded by Kershak. Cain’s spirit escaped to the non-physical plain, but his body and acolytes were destroyed. This made Cain angry at both Kershak for betraying him, and himself for being so foolish

entries.name: Pact With Aurelius
entries: In 1713, Cain for the first time in a while heard someone praying to his name. The person was Aurelius Aerwyna, who, feeling betrayed by her aunt and was under stress from an imminent raid by Selatis, was looking for knowledge and power. Cain, desperate and interested in her story and potential, made her his first acolyte in over a hundred years.

entries.name: Armentus
entries: Armentus is the demon of obsession and perfectionism who is calling Krabmann and teleported Omurice. Armentus is the youngest child of Sellarus and Hebeshca, and the sister of Cain and Kershak

entries.name: Family Relations
entries: Armentus was pretty neutral to Sellarus but had a great bond with Hebeshca. She learned her mother’s art of making things remain hidden, and aspired to be like her.
Armentus had ok relations with Cain, but she knew he didn’t value any of her projects and was often annoyed with her. Armentus disliked Kershak, who she saw as egotistical.

entries.name: Freaxir (1320)
entries: In 1320 Armentus decided she wanted followers like other demons and she wanted them to be very knowledgeable about the arcane. She made contact with the similarly valued Elesira Ceydor who was open to the idea and collected others who sought to build a hub of knowledge. By selling enchanted objects and spells, the group was able to collect funds to build the school and house many magical books and items. Throughout this process, Armentus became more interested in creating the best institution to learn magic rather than followers. Throughout this process Armentus also became very close with Ceydor, who she made an actual acolyte.

When Kershak began conquering the north, Ceydor expressed her own and her student’s fears of invasion. Armentus agreed, and made a deal with Kershak ensuring Freaxir would be protected if Bardoran took the area over. When Bardoran eventually did, Freaxir was ordered to be undisturbed in return for cooperation. After making this deal with Kershak, Armentus went into hiding in the deep chasms of the ocean using the techniques she learned from her mother knowing that he might vilify her at some point

entries.name: The Will of Sellarus(1323)
entries: When Sellarus made the will, Armentus initially thought it was hilarious as she knew Kershak would be enraged. She then tasked her followers with collecting info on the will. It was through this tactic that she learned about the Writ of Hebeshca.

Ceydor found the Writ of Hebeshca and kept it at Freaxir until Serick asked for it. Ceydor gave it to him because of the Armentus - Kershak deal, but put a tracking spell on it so she and Armentus could see its location.

entries.name: Armentus Chosen (1713)
entries: Hidden in the ocean, Armentus observed many creatures including water genasi. At this time, Armentus wanted to find individuals who could help her without alerting Kershak. She saw Krabmann as a strong willed individual with much promise. Having a soft spot for the underdog she fixated on him and decided he would be a good candidate. Knowing the location of the Writ of Hebeshca, She mysteriously called Krabmann to remain hidden but still accomplish her task

At the same time, Ceydor was on the lookout for talented magic users to help Armentus on her search. Ceydor took note of Omurice who, from Vice Chancellor Berids’s complaints, She learned had great potential. Ceydor expressed Omurice’s professors’ testimony of his promise, and Omurice’s ambition to Armentus was interested in him.

When Armentus called Krabmann to the Writ of Hemeshca, she suddenly realized how naive he was and decided he needed help before entering such a drastically new environment. She decided to teleport Omurice to his location, and luckily they seemed to get along.

entries.name: Dremin Warberset
entries: Dremin Warberset is the king of Bardoran

entries.name: Early Life (1495 - 1526)
entries: Dremin Warberset was born when Bardoran was a much smaller kingdom. He, like most Bardonians at the time, was born into a mining family. Warberset had dreams of becoming a leader, and wanted to unite the nearby nations under one flag. At the time, Warberset imagined this union to form through treaties and economic trade.

entries.name: Rise to Power (1526 - 1545)
entries: hen he was 31, Warberset made a deal with a forge in a nearby kingdom where he would get 30 pickaxes and they would get some mined resources. Those who Warberset gave the new pickaxes easily made back what was lost, and made good profits for Bardoran. This made him a sort of local hero amongst a few families.

Barus Torid, the king at the time, took notice to this negotiation, and began making similar negotiations on a larger scale. Barus also took a liking to Warberset, who he asked to meet. Torid found Warberset's spirit inspiring, and made him an advisor.
In 1545, Barus Torid decided to step down, and wanting to give Bardoran a positive future he gave his crown to Warberset.

entries.name: First Years as King (1545 - 1562)
entries: Once he became king, Warberset continued the economic agreements with surrounding nations. During these years, the citizens of Bardoran thought Warberset was an inspiring king that may actually secure better lives for the citizens of Bardoran. The nearby nations found the young king to be overly ambitious. Whenever he brought up the topic of a union, the other nations were unwilling, but they still wanted to continue economic agreements.

entries.name: Growing Conflict (1562 - 1576)
entries: In 1562, Warberset began the construction of a forge for Bardoran. The people of Bardoran saw this as a great step forward and supported this decision. The surrounding nations however felt somewhat betrayed as Bardoran previously had been making trade agreements to use their forges. As a result the nearby nations decreased trade with Bardoran and increased with eachother. This stunted Bardoran's growth and made Warberset angery

Around this time, Warberset had also been negotiating borders for each kingdom to avoid territory conflict between the miners. Once again, Warberset brought up the option of a union, but was rejected. Following the announcement of the Bardoran forge, the nearby nations made an agreement to share mining territory. This union that Bardoran was cut out of enraged Warberset. And he began resenting the bordering nations.

entries.name: The Start of Conquest (1576)
entries: In 1576, Kershak emerged from the volcanic mines of Bardoran and made a deal with Warberset. Warberset saw the deal as not only a way to achive his goal of forming a great dwarven kingdom, but also a form of revenge on the nearby nations.

Warberset had an easy time convincing most of his subjects to go to war, as territory conflicts between them and the other nations had resulted in small brawls already. With the introduction of a demon to the army, those who had doubts about Bardoran’s success were quickly reassured.
Warberset declared war in 1576 under the reasoning of economic betrayal and failure to uphold border agreements

entries.name: The Conquest (1576 - 1608)
entries: After the bordering nations had been conquered, Warberset and Bardoran as a whole felt invigorated, and wanted to follow through with Warberset’s dreams of creating a great nation. Kershak had a great role in convincing Warberset to "see [his] vision through" .

During the first battles Warberset actually participated in the conquering of the nations bordering Bardoran. As time went on, Warberset directed the war from his increasingly more comfortable fortress

Following his battle with Merazarx in 1607, Kershak convinced Warberset to stop expanding. Warberset grew tired of the war at this point anyways, and wanted to admire and enjoy the benefits of his empire. When Artoz attacked in 1608, Warberset sent an immense number of troops with the goal of ending the battle as quickly as possible. Once they had, Warberset pulled most of his troops back to Bardoran and began to expand control on Warberland much more passivley

entries.name: Gratin Harkin
entries: Grantin Harkin is a noble of Bardoran who owns the Grand Harkin Forge. He is the namesake of the Harkin pass and the creator of the Bardoran berserkers

entries.name: Early Life (1481 - 1576)
entries: Harkin was born into a somewhat poor family in pre-conquest Bardoran. As Bardoran and its neighboring kingdoms expanded, tensions rose between the miners of each kingdom. Harkin had multiple encounters with the other miners, and was in one of the few interactions that resulted in a small brawl. He was very cutthroat during this brawl and single handedly left five dwarves wounded.

entries.name: The Conquest (1576 - 1608)
entries: Once the conquest started, Harkin was one of the first to rush in (after Kershak). He organized a group of similarly violent dwarves that would all rush in with him with little regard for their own safety. This tactic proved to be very effective to scare and confuse enemies. Dremin Warberset took notice and made him a general and the berserker an official type of soldier of the Bardoran military.
In one of the first battles of the conquest, Harkin and his berserkers chased their enemies throughout that kingdom’s forge. Warberset gave ownership to the new general as a result

During one of the raids led by Harkin, he pushed his enemies south until they attempted to escape through the pass between the Gray Mountains and the Forlorn Mountains. Gratin himself chased them with berserker companions, and caught up with them. Gratin wrote to Dremin, suggesting the pass may be used for economic trade. Dremin agreed, and named the pass after Harkin.

entries.name: Benest Trask
entries: Benest Trask is the Bardoran noble who owns the Trask Grand Forge and is the namesake for the Trask Mountains

entries.name: Early Life (1496 - 1545)
entries: Trask was born into a family of miners in pre-conquest Bardoran. He grew up a friend of Dremin Warberset, and was one of those who got a new pickaxe when Warberset negotiated for them. Trask supported Warberset when he became an advisor to Barus Torid. When Warberset took power, he made Trask an advisor.

entries.name: Advising The King (1545 - 1576)
entries: As Warberset’s advisor, Trask evaluated the needs of the miners and reported them. Since he was originally a miner, Trask got along with the miners and was able to get good insight on their lives.

As time went on the miners of Bardoran and the miners of nearby nations began to mine in the same areas, resulting in disputes between the groups. Trask was very aware of the rising tensions and he grew angry at the nearby nations. After some violent interactions between the groups, Trask encouraged Warberset to take military control of the area, but Warberset didn’t believe Bardoran had the military strength. While Trask agreed, He was still quite mad.

entries.name: The Conquest (1576 - 1608)
entries: Once the conquest began, Trask eagerly led the Bardoran troops into battle (after Kershak). Trask continued to lead troops into battle throughout the conquest, so Warberset naturally made him a general.

Trask played a great role in convincing the dwarves of other nations to join the Bardoran army. He would contrast their lives as poor miners to what it could be if they were part of a grand empire. Since his experience with miners made his offer very attractive to the other dwarves.
Kershak influenced Trask to continue pushing east, and for Trask it became a sort of game and a boost to his ego at every new victory.

From 1604 - 1606 Trask successfully led his troops through what is now called the Trask mountains, attacking and displacing those who dwell in them. The area had not been inhibited by dwarves and not much mining had been done there. Trask communicated the opportunity for industry in the area, and Warberset gave him the resources and manpower to build a new forge. The forge and the mountain range was then named after Trask by Warberset.

entries.name: Romil Torrid
entries: Romil Torid is a noble of Bardoran who specializes in economic trade and growth. The namesake of the Torid Grand Forge

entries.name: Early Life (1430 - 1545)
entries: Romil Torrid is the son of Barus Torid, and was part of the upper class of early Bardoran once. Dremin Warberset became an advisor or Barus, Romil and Dremin became friends. Watching the stress his father was always under, Romil didn’t want to become king. Romil suggested Warberset become king when Barus was thinking of stepping down. Dremin made Romil one of his advisors once he took power.

entries.name: Advising The King (1545 - 1576)
entries: As an advisor to Warberset, Torid proved to be very gifted in the field of economics. He was very particular about keeping records of purchases, production, and sales. Likewise he was great at utilizing economic patterns to sell and purchase at the best times. Torid worked with Warberset to create beneficial and tempting trade agreements for all parties

After a series of very profitable years for Bardoran, Warberset suggested Bardoran construct a forge. Torid went to work evaluating costs and found that the introduction of a forge in Bardoran would be a great benefit for the nation and increase the economic growth of the entire region.

When Warberset announced the plans for a forge to the nation, the neighboring nations saw a threat as they had previously been making trade agreements to allow Bardoran use their forges. These nations reacted by reducing trade with Bardoran and trading amongst each other. This stunted Bardoran’s economic growth which in turn prevented the forge from being built. Torid was furious.

entries.name: The Conquest (1576 - 1608)
entries: When the conquest began, Torid remained in Bardoran to calculate the costs and profits of the war. His rage towards the neighboring nations made the gained resources all the more sweeter

After the conquest of the first kingdoms Bardoran was able to acquire its forge. Warbreset put Torid in charge of the forge for the production of military equipment. Torid not only exceeded the needed production, but also expanded the forge itself. Warberset responded by renaming the forge after Torid.

During the conquest Torid received many benefits from Warberset for his contributions to the war. Torid began to lose touch with the working class and instead became obsessed with efficiency and profits. The most efficient way he found for running the forge was with an iron fist. Kershak sometimes talked to Torid and played a large role in influencing Torid's values

entries.name: Serick
entries: Undead warlock who serves Kershak.

entries.name: Early Life (1378 - 1399)
entries: Serick was born into a poor family in what is now Kortain as Steven Cromil. Growing up his father was a shepard and his family was always on the move following the sheep. He never had a permanent place of residence, and he never had many strong relationships as a result. He instead looked up to his parents, but was very aware that he had a much worse life than others. While he often had little to eat or wear as he traveled, He passed the comfortable mansions of others who treated him as trash, and he felt that way too.

As he aged, Serick grew full of hatred. He could handle his poor life, but as his parents aged he saw they could not. When he was 15 Serick’s mother was raped by a wealthy landowner, and Serick responded by killinging him in the middle of the night. Serick was quickly put in prison and he spent 6 years there. When he got out. His parents had sold most of the sheep because of hard times, and now were even poorer.

entries.name: Becoming Serick (1399 - 1409)
entries: Serick’s parents began to become unable to tend to the few sheep remaining because of sickness, so Serick began to steal. He was quite good at stealing, and was never caught in the act. In 1409 he stole from a group of bandits who tracked him down and killed his parents in front of him, and beat him, leaving him to die.

With his last breath, Serick said he would kill all of the bandits and began praying (to nothing in particular) asking for revenge. Kershak answered his prayer and held Serick in a state just after death as he asked for Serick’s story.
Kershak was quite happy with the hatred he saw in the man. Kershak revived him, made Serick his acolyte, and gave him his new name.

entries.name: Descent into Madness (1409 - Present)
entries: Serick made true to his promise and killed all of the bandits. His newfound power was intoxicating and he began to lose any sense of empathy he once had. He began to only remember all the pain he felt throughout his life, and wanted to inflict it back onto the world.
Serick eargerly did Kershak's bidding as it often involved causing pain onto others. He reveled in the fear people had when they saw him
